rottapeli.peli

Class RottaPeli

  • java.lang.Object
    • rottapeli.peli.RottaPeli

  • public class RottaPeli
extends Object
    Central hub of the program that stores all components of the game.

    Provides global game logic decisions.

    Author:
    Pavel

    • Constructor Detail

      • RottaPeli

        public RottaPeli(boolean createsGUI)
        Constructor.

        Creates all components needed for the game.

        Parameters:
        createsGUI - Set to true to create GUI. Can be set to false to improve testing environment.

        public void setFrame(JFrame fr)

      • createGUI

        public void createGUI()
        Creates GUI window

      • createBorders

        public void createBorders()
        Creates Bouncable Borders around the playing field and a layer of PlacementBlockers.

        PlacementBlockers are placed to prevent situations where Ball kills Rat immediately in the beginning of the game. Also prevents placing cheese to easy spots.

      • createAndPositionToFreeSpot

        public void createAndPositionToFreeSpot(Positioned p)
        Creates a Positioned Entity and places it to the free spot.
        Parameters:
        p - Entity that is to be placed. Parameter is usually given as a constructor without parameters in order to place it to the defaultPosition().

      • playerGo

        public void playerGo(int id,
            double dir)
        Signals Controllable Entity to move to a certain direction.
        Parameters:
        id - Player ID that are supposed to receive this signal.
        dir - Direction towards which Entities are supposed to go.

      • resetPosition

        public void resetPosition(Class type,
                 boolean spotMustBeFree)
        Resets all Entities of a certain type to their defaultPosition().
        Parameters:
        type - Class or Interface of the Entity that need to be reset. Use null or Entity.class to reset all Entities.
        spotMustBeFree - Set to true if Entity requires to be placed at an unoccupied location.

      • playerDied

        public void playerDied(int id)
        Reacts to the event of certain player dying.

        Player loses a life. Resets Balls if amount of players is one.

        Parameters:
        id - ID of the player that died.

      • playerLostAllLives

        public void playerLostAllLives(int id)
        Reacts to the event of certain player losing all of her/his lives.

        Removes all Entities that are controlled by the player. If all players have lost their lives, show high score.

        Parameters:
        id - ID of the player that lost all lives.

      • isGameOver

        public boolean isGameOver()
        Returns:
        True if the game is over.

      • playerAteCheese

        public void playerAteCheese(int id)
        Reacts to the event of certain player eating cheese.

        Gives points. If no cheese left go to the next stage and give a time bonus.

        Parameters:
        id - ID of the player that ate cheese.

      • nextStage

        public void nextStage()
        Goes to the next stage.

        Resets Rat's and Balls', resets Cheese and increases Ball amount by one.

      • getPlayers

        public Set<Integer> getPlayers()
        Examines how many different players are playing the game.
        Returns:
        A Set of player IDs that exist in the game. Use getPlayers().size() to calculate the amount in integer.

      • resetGame

        public void resetGame()
        Resets all Entities, resets Score.

      • resetDemo

        public void resetDemo()
        Resets Entities in order to show a demo of the game without players involvement.
